text: The rapid advancement of data aggregation and deep learning algorithms has positioned artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) as transformative forces in the field of medicine. Orthopedics, in particular, stands to benefit significantly from these technological innovations, which offer insights capable of enhancing various aspects of care provided by orthopedic surgeons. This review aims to critically assess recent and innovative literature concerning ML applications in orthopedics and to explore their potential implications for the future of musculoskeletal care.
name: bla-102
